Let us take a look at space usage(Keep in mind these aren't 100% accurate as I only quickly sliced the image into rectangular shapes, but for arguments sake it is still relevant).

Overall Pixel Count : 256,000

Champion Selection Area: 37,812 (14.7%)
Picked Champions Area: 92,976 (36.3%)
Chat Area: 29,197 (11.4%)

Other areas being Rune/Mastery Selection, Bans, Random Champ portrait next to Rune/Mastery Selection. My question is this, why does the Picked Champion Area overshadow the most important visual of Champ select by over 2x.

I'd be interested to see statistics on who does what.  Personally I just enjoy seeing the champion list, it's nice to be able to scroll through it and pick champions rather than needing to search.  The main thing about this rework that gets me, in this regard, is that there are 20% fewer champions shown on the screen at any given time.  The current live client shows 4 rows of 10, this rework shows 4 rows of 8.  

In addition, there's just no reason that the portraits themselves are so much larger than the main source of interaction.  You don't interact with portraits or bans, they are just visual.  The only real interaction portions are the section where you choose your champion and the chat box, and they are the smallest/least visually present elements in the entire window.

I love the design and think this is an **AWESOME** Champion Select screen!

But under the sleek new look and polish, I can see some flaws and if you don't mind, I'll write some feedback that I believe could greatly improve it.
______
1. It needs to have the Summoner Names under the splash arts to see who picked what champion and who is talking.

2. The 'lock in' button is just a picture of the champion so for new players, I can see them being really confused as to where it is. I think it should actually say 'lock in' and be on the right side where it's always been for clarity.

3. The Annie splash art being mirrored really triggers my inner OCD. I really don't like it.

4. The bans should really need labelled. Leaving them unlabelled like that for veteran players is fine, but once again. Someone who doesn't play this regularly or spectates wouldn't know what that is.

5. The Blue and Red side need to be more pronounced. You can barely tell what side you're going to be on and for some color blind people, the background for the sides looks the same.

6. This is just a request mostly, but it would be really cool if we could get a 'select ward skin' button.
______
Other than that. This is an extremely well done Champion Select screen. I hope that Riot will implement something that looks like this.

I really love the design, it's quite pretty.

That being said, I think something like this could only really work if the client could be fullscreen; there is a ton of space being taken up by those champion portraits, and the champion selection box really suffers because of it.  There's also a lot going on with the interface here and it could potentially be a bit distracting,

Basically, from a UI perspective it's beautiful.  From a UX perspective it needs some work, namely with sizing and maybe bringing out the middle rather than making the sides stand out so dramatically.  There is also a significant amount of empty space where the champion selection box curves upward at the bottom, on each side; this makes the box look even smaller than the space affords.

In this remake there are 8 champions displayed horizontally rather than the 10 displayed in live, with the same four rows.  This is 32 champions displayed at once rather than 40, which is effectively a 20% reduction in usability.

One other question: If Riot were to increase the number of bans, where would this fit into the UI rework you have designed?  The current implementation has space built into the UI for another two bans on each side (for a total of ten bans) if needed.

Edit: This just occurred to me, where is the Lock In button?
Agreed, i think the LoL client should be full screen, while being able to minimize it like the normal one.
